pages.text: Every merchant knows that the price of a $(l:overview/goods)Good$() is determined by $(bold)Supply and Demand$().$(p)$(bold)Supply$() refers to how much of a $(l:overview/goods)Good$() is available in a $(l:overview/commodity_markets)Commodity Market$(), while $(bold)Demand$() refers to how many people are interested in buying that $(l:overview/goods)Good$().$(p)High Supply will $(bold)decrease$() the price of a $(l:overview/goods)Good$(), while high Demand will $(bold)increase$() it.

In Tradewinds, each $(l:overview/goods)Good$() has a specific list of factors that can affect its Supply and Demand. These factors can be found in its individual page in the $(l:goods)List of Goods$().$(p)Buying and selling $(l:overview/goods)Goods$() will also affect their Supply in a $(l:overview/commodity_markets)Commodity Market$(). Buying will decrease the Supply of a $(l:overview/goods)Good$(), while selling will increase it.
